Karol Lewandowski

MSc (Eng), PhD

604 Rankine Building

79 Oakfield Avenue

G12 8LT, Glasgow

I am a Research Associate and a member of EPSRC-supported Glasgow Computational Engineering Centre (GCEC). Currently, I am working as PDRA in an EPSRC project on predictive modelling of Incremental Cold Flow Forming (ICFF).

My PhD project, supported by Lord Kelvin and Adam Smith Scholarship, was focused on computational methods to predict and prevent musculoskeletal injury and fatality in the Thoroughbred racehorse.

My main interests are: computational mechanics, additive manufacturing technology, virtual and augmented reality scientific visualisation and sustainable research code development (mostly C++).

I am a senior developer of finite element library at the MoFEM team.
